result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben Luna-Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Co-defts, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not enter or be in US w/out valid documents, report changes in immigration status to agent w/in 72 hours, notify agent w/in 24 hours of ICE custody release, may not associate w/ people who use controlled substances.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Domingo Cruz.  Spanish interpreter Leo Martin also appears with the DE; interpreter sworn in.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The DE sumbits a letter to the court.  The court imposes a total sentence of 13 years WSP w/credit for 322 days served; 7 years initial confinement and 6 years extended supervision w/conditions.  No contact with the co-defendants.    Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
